messages.title: Elin: Still Fighting
messages.content: After announcing that she will stand again to be Ceredigion's Assembly Member, The Cariad met up with Elin Jones AM to discuss her past four years, the carid.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Elin advocates for better healthcare services with more direct access to a health minister. Highlights the need for intervention on issues like waiting times and mental health support.

issues.environment: Mention of consistent work on local environmental concerns, including actions on saving the local river from pollution and flooding issues.
issues.health: Elin advocates for better healthcare services with more direct access to a health minister. Highlights the need for intervention on issues like waiting times and mental health support.

housing.content: Elin highlights her intervention in children's care facilities and mentions being a constant working presence as an Assembly Member in the area.

leaflet.personalStatement: As an Assembly Member, I've been accessible, working throughout Ceredigion, for Ceredigion. This is not just a job - it’s my way of life. Every week, when I ask questions in the Senedd or meet with Ministers, I’m standing up for Ceredigion.

politicalExperience.achievements: Worked on local environmental issues, children's care facilities, and accessibility to healthcare services.

quotes.text: Mae tipyn o'r gwaith rwy'n di ymglyd a fo ddim llawer i'w weld - fel gwaith papur neu ryw gyfarfod...Mae'r rhan fwyaf o'r hyn rwyf wedi ei wneud...wedi amseru o gychwyniad i ddiod...Mae hwn yn gyfai i o' bell:
You must get some time off. Don’t you take any holidays?

images.caption: Elin Jones speaking with a constituent.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Elin underlines her commitment to Ceredigion, citing her role as a constant presence as an Assembly Member. She addresses her efforts in environmental issues, children's care facilities, and healthcare. Elin emphasizes that being an Assembly Member is more than just a job, it’s her way of life.
